section.title: Description
section.para: GoGui is a graphical interface to programs that play the game of Go and use the Go Text Protocol.

It is especially useful for Go program developers, since it allows direct communication with the program by sending any GTP command and to log and save the stream of sent GTP commands to facilitate debugging and reproducing errors.

note.title: Notes on using GCJ
note.para: The implementation of the javax.swing classes is incomplete in GCJ. The current status (tested with GCJ 4.0.0) is: everything compiles, the console based tools (e.g. GtpRegress, GtpDummy) seem to work, the graphical programs GoGui and GtpDisplay don't work. GtpDisplay seems to work mostly, but it does not make advantage of Graphics2D based features (color gradient on stones). It also throws a GTK error, when trying to pop up dialog windows.
